@graph.title: Artful armies, beautiful battles : art and warfare in early modern Europe
@graph.abstract: Military science, history, and art / Guy Wilson -- Warfare and artistic production in the German lands during the Thirty Years War (1618-48) / Sigrun Haude -- Shining armor : Emperor Maximilian, chivalry, and war / Larry Silver -- Images of warfare as political legitimization : Jörg Breu the Elder's rondels for Maximilian I's hunting lodge at Lermos (ca. 1516) / Pia F. Cuneo -- Giogio Vasari's and Niccolò Machiavelli's Medicean emblams of war and peace in the portrait of Duke Alessandro de Medici / Liana de Girolami Cheney -- Seventeenth-century French images of warfare / Julie Anne Plax -- Soldiers and gypsies : outsiders and their families in early sixteenth century German art / R. Andrew Morrall -- Remembering Amalek and Nebuchadnezzar : biblical warfare and symbolic violence in two images in Italian Renaissance Yiddish books of customs / Diane Wolfthal -- Battling fortune in sixteenth-century Italy : Cellini and the changing faces of Fortuna / Gwendolyn Trottein
